To-do: Apply butterworth band-pass filter
Divide continuous data into 150 samples window
Discard useless data : 192ch → 168ch
Compute RMS for each channel
Perform baseline normalization
Check whether each window is represented by a 168-dimensional vector of RMS values
Apply spatial order 3 1-dimensional median filter on the vector to compensate local artifacts
Compute average of the summarized RMS values per window → threshold
If the sum of RMS vector elements of one window is greater than the threshold, it's ACTIVE
If the predecessor and successor is active, it's ACTIVE
Check whether it's well operating until now
Select the longest contiguous sequence of active windows → gesture segment
compute RMS for each channel on all windows → feature (of each channel)
Edit code to be more effective (decrease the number of for loops)
Apply feedbacks from mento
Normalize the mean RMS over all channels
Result : 168 * N dimensional feature RMS vector. With RMS is length normalized
Model the feature distribution by kernel density estimation with Gaussian kernel function
Apply naive Bayes classifier for each 27 classes
